intro: Leucospermum zeyheri var. truncatum, commonly known as the Zeyher’s star flower, is a South African plant belonging to the Proteaceae family. It is characterized by its striking, cone-shaped inflorescences that bear numerous small, bright yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has a shrub-like appearance with narrow, leathery leaves. It is adapted to sandy soils and is often found in the Western and Northern Cape provinces. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens but is also threatened by habitat loss and invasive species.
